snippet: A new study found that the caliber of the words spoken to young children was more valuable than the number of words heard in the development of a child’s language skills.
abstract: New study finds the quality of words spoken to young children is more valuable than the number of words heard in the development of a child’s language skills.
lead_paragraph: A new study found that the caliber of the words spoken to young children was more valuable than the number of words heard in the development of a child’s language skills.

headline.main: Quality of Words, Not Quantity, Is Crucial to Language Skills, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Quality of Words, Not Quantity, Is Crucial to Language Skills, Study Finds
